paragraph0.bullet_point0: Meet the requirement for open access to articles and other research results by depositing in an open knowledge archive
paragraph0.bullet_point1: Publish reports, student theses and other material produced at the institution
paragraph0.intro: By using NVA, Norwegian research institutions are able to:

description.paragraph1: NVA is also being developed for use when reporting scientific publication to the Ministry of Education and Research and the Ministry of Health and Care Services (NVI reporting), and for other administrative tasks.
description.paragraph2: Sikt is the data processor. The individual institution is the data controller and registers and maintains its own content in the service, and configures distribution rules for published resources (articles, reports, data sets, etc.). The service also receives content from other data sources.
description.paragraph3: NVA supports deferred publication of resources. This means that a registration can be completed so that metadata about the resource is published, while the resource itself is not open until the specified date. The service does not allow the processing of sensitive personal data.
description.paragraph4: NVA will make the institution's open content available via open interfaces, with the intention of making this known and searchable to the outside world, and promoting indexing in search engines and search portals.
description.paragraph5: Although NVA has been established and in use by several institutions, the service will be in continuous development throughout its lifetime. Institutions that do not have a research archive can contact <0>Sikt</0> to use NVA as a pilot institution.

about.footer_text: The service is delivered by Sikt — Norwegian Agency for Shared Services in Education and Research
about.short_description: The National Research Archive (NVA) gathers information about Norwegian research, and makes research results and research information openly accessible.

authorization.accept_terms_to_create_user: I agree to be created as a user in NVA
authorization.cancel_create_user_text: You must create a user to proceed. If you cancel, you will be logged out. Do you want to cancel?

doi.doi_information_bullet_points_2: The service has support for assigning $t(common.doi_long) to results.|The institution that assigns the DOI becomes the publisher of the result.|A thorough check of metadata, contents of files and licenses is necessary before assigning a $t(common.doi_long). Incorrect metadata is time-consuming to correct afterwards.

retention_strategy.creator_can_override_rrs_text: <0>The institution has made it possible for the registrar to choose not to follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS). By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S.</0></0> <1>In NVA, the registrar removes RRS from the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article. The RRS checkbox appears by clicking on the arrow icon under the accepted version of the file. By removing the check from RRS, the selected license on the file is removed and the license must be selected again.</1>
retention_strategy.curator_can_override_rrs_text: <0>The publishing curator has access to set that files do not follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS).</0> <0>If the registrar does not wish to follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS), look at the terms for not following RRS on the information page about the institution's rights retention strategy.</0> <1>By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S</0>.</1>
retention_strategy.customer_has_no_rrs: <0>The institution has not provided a rights retention strategy (RRS) in NVA.</0> <0>Without an institutional rights retention strategy, it is up to the registrar to set the correct license on the accepted version of files in the registration of scientific articles.</0> <1>It is up to the registrar to potentially mark whether the publication should follow an RRS. By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S.</0></1> <0>If the publication is funded by an actor that requires adherence to RRS (ref. Plan S), then RRS must be set. In NVA, the registrar sets RRS on the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article. The RRS checkbox appears by clicking on the arrow icon under the accepted version of the file. By checking the box for RRS, the license for the file is set to CC-BY.</0>
retention_strategy.customer_has_rrs_text: <0>The institution has provided a rights retention strategy (RRS) in NVA.</0> <0>The CC-BY licence is set when you choose the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article in NVA.</0>v
retention_strategy.possible_not_to_follow_rrs: Possible to not follow the institution's rights retention policy
retention_strategy.rrs_info_page: The institution's information page about rights policy

footer.about_nva_text: The national research archive (NVA) collects publications and other research results, and makes them openly available in a common national solution. This makes results from Norwegian research available in a single service.
footer.about_sikt_text: Sikt enters an agreement with each individual institution regarding use of the service. Customers are typically universities, university colleges, research institutes and organizations in the health sector.

description.cc0: The person who associated a work with this deed has dedicated the work to the public domain by waiving all of his or her rights to the work worldwide under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights, to the extent allowed by law.

helper_text_modal.detailed_paragraph_1: If you have an ORCID, you are encouraged to link it to your researcher profile. If you do not have an ORCID, you can create it at the same time as you link it to your researcher profile.
helper_text_modal.detailed_paragraph_2: Some publishers and funders require you to have an ORCID, in order to submit manuscripts and applications for funding respectively. If they do not require it, you as a researcher should demand it. Your research results will become easier for everyone to cite correctly and there is less work afterwards. Linking ORCID to your researcher profile is an offer, not a requirement. You can withdraw your link whenever you want under MY PAGE | Personal information.
helper_text_modal.introduction: ORCID provides you with a permanent, digital identifier that you own and control, distinguishing you from other researchers. By linking your ORCID to your researcher profile, the NVA will be able to import more of your publications in the future, faster and more accurately.
helper_text_modal.link: For more information go to ORCID

orcid.orcid_description: To connect your ORCID iD, sign into ORCID. Or register to create your ORCID iD and connect. This makes it easier to identify you
orcid.remove_connection_info:

If you want to revoke Sikt's access to read your ORCID, please go to your ORCID profile.

about.heading: About the privacy statement
about.paragraph: This privacy statement describes how the data controller processes your personal data in the service. The purpose of this privacy statement is to inform you about what personal data is processed, how it is processed, who is responsible for the processing, what your rights are and who you can contact.

automatic_case_processing.heading: Automatic case processing
automatic_case_processing.paragraph0: Personal data related to system users will not be subject to automated case processing or profiling.
automatic_case_processing.paragraph1: Open personal data related resources may be subject to profiling by services that harvest information from NVA, but will not be profiled as part of the service.

section0.heading: The data controller
section0.paragraph: The institution is responsible for processing personal data in the service and is the primary point of contact for users.

section1.heading: Data processor
section1.paragraph: Sikt develops and manages the service on behalf of the data controller and has the role of data processor.

section2.intro: Contact information for Sikt user support:

disclosure_of_data.heading: Disclosure of your personal data to third parties
disclosure_of_data.paragraph0: Disclosure or export of data is defined as any disclosure of data except to the data subject's own system/processing or to the data subject himself or anyone receiving data on their behalf.
disclosure_of_data.paragraph1: Personal data linked to users is not transferred to countries outside the EU/EEA.
disclosure_of_data.paragraph2: The service is operated on servers in the EU/EEA.

paragraph3.intro: Your personal data will be disclosed to Sikt, which is the service provider, and to its subcontractors:

table.caption: Overview of subcontractors who may receive personal data

row0.col0: Supplier in framework agreement for AWS through the GÉANT collaboration
row0.col1: Cloud management and backup for Sikt's direct services

row1.col1: Cloud management and backup for Sikt's direct services

row2.col1: Provides Feide, for authentication of users of the services

disclosure_of_data.paragraph4: Employees of the subcontractors who need access to the personal data to perform their work will have adapted access in order to provide on-site maintenance, user support and any correction of errors in the service.
disclosure_of_data.paragraph5: Open personal data linked to the resources is shared openly with external services. This includes search services such as Oria and OpenAIRE, as well as search engines that index data via the web pages such as Google, Baidu, Bing etc.

paragraph6.intro: See the following table for the service's integrations:

row1.col0: Import of material to NVA from external services
row1.col1: Export of metadata for resources to other services for presentation or cross-registration. For example, Oria to facilitate retrieval.
row1.col2: Sources defined by the data controller

row2.col0: Export of metadata from NVA to external service
row2.col1: Export of metadata for resources to other services for presentation or cross-registration. For example, Oria to facilitate retrieval.
row2.col2: Sikt for Oria. Sources defined by the data controller.

row3.col1: The registrar can request the assignment of a Document Object Identifier (DOI) to a resource in NVA. This will cause selected metadata to be published in DataCite - a source regularly indexed by search engines.

row4.col1: Establish a link to the authority register for authorization of author, editor, supervisor and other creator or contributor registered in the service. To facilitate unambiguous registration and retrieval.

row5.col1: Establish a link to ORCID for authorization of author, editor, supervisor and other creator or contributor registered in the service. To facilitate unambiguous registration and retrieval.

purpose.heading: The purpose of personal data processing in the service
purpose.paragraph: The service processes different types of personal data for the following purposes:

row0.col1: Archive administrator, editor, curator. Typically employees at the institution.
row0.col2: Administration of the service, including maintenance of content and configuration of access to functions and content. Administrative users must be registered with their identity to obtain rights in the service.

row1.col1: User who registers material in the service. Persons associated with the institution who have logged on to the service.
row1.col2: Registration of material in the service. Authenticated users must be registered with their identity in order to obtain rights in the service.

row2.col1: Persons or services that accessed the service without logging in, identified by IP address(es) and cookies.
row2.col2: Anonymous users are granted access to open resources in the service. The service logs necessary information to prevent abuse of the service and to generate aggregated statistics on the use of the resources.

row3.col0: Persons linked to the registered resource
row3.col1: Author, editor, supervisor or other creator or contributor to a resource registered in the service.
row3.col2: Cataloging, crediting and accountability of the persons behind the resource.

row4.col1: Any persons and pertaining data in the published material.
row4.col2: Availability of published resource. The content manager must ensure data protection in the resource together with the data controller before it is published in the service

registered_personal_data.heading: Registered personal data, legal grounds and storage period
registered_personal_data.paragraph0: Personal data related to user accounts in the service requires consent as a legal basis, cf. the <0>Personal Data Act, and the GDPR Article 6</0>(1)(a)
registered_personal_data.paragraph1: Registered personal data about authors and contact persons are covered by the <0>Personal Data Act, and the GDPR Article 6(1)</0>(f) – to perform a task of legitimate interests.
registered_personal_data.paragraph2: The service does not permit processing of sensitive personal data. In cases where users themselves can write information in the comment fields and the like, the user is obliged to follow requirements and guidelines for the service. Users are not permitted to register sensitive data about themselves or others, or to use the service for defamatory conduct.
registered_personal_data.paragraph3: The data controller may store information for statistical purposes if this is in the interests of society at large, cf. the <0>Personal Data Act Section 8</0> and the <1>GDPR Article 6</1>(1)(e)
registered_personal_data.paragraph4: The following personal data is processed in the service:
registered_personal_data.paragraph5: Information about your activity is stored in order to provide user support and to gain insight into general use of the service.

paragraph6.bullet_point1: The purpose of the personal data processing has been fulfilled
paragraph6.bullet_point2: The data controller decides to discontinue the service
paragraph6.intro: Personal data is stored until one of the following events occur:

registered_personal_data.paragraph7: Logs and backups of system data are stored for up to one year.
registered_personal_data.paragraph8: User information (except logs) is stored for the lifetime of the resource for users who register content in the service.

row0.col1: Full name and role of author, editor, supervisor or other author or contributor
row0.col2: Registered in NVA or imported from external source

row1.col0: Personal data in the resource itself
row1.col1: Persons identified in the resource. Content in the resource must be quality assured by the person responsible before it can be published.
row1.col2: The resource is uploaded in NVA upon registration or imported from external source

row0.col1: Identities in the service and integrated systems. Feide iD, Author iD, ORCID iD

row1.col0: System roles and affiliation to the institution
row1.col1: The user is assigned roles in the system in order to provide customized functionality and access to the service.

row2.col1: Information related to the user’s dialogue with the service. Necessary to customize functionality in the service and authenticate users.

row3.col1: Log of system use related to the logged-in user and/or their IP address. IP addresses will be registered for anonymous users, which in some cases can be traced back to an individual. The purpose of these logs is to ensure security and integrity in the system, provide user support and analyze service usage. The data that is collected includes time, user ID, IP address, browser- and hardware information, session information and other information that the browser normally provides.

row1.col1: E-mail address assigned at your own institution.

row2.col1: User's preferences for using the service. Language choice, Institutional affiliation.

security_for_personal_data.heading: Security of your personal data
security_for_personal_data.paragraph0: Personal data processed in the service is secured with several measures. All transfers to and from the service associated with user accounts are encrypted. The data processor performs regular risk and vulnerability analyses, and tests the security of the service to secure your personal data.
security_for_personal_data.paragraph1: The data controller is responsible for routines that address data protection in connection with the publication of content.

service_in_brief.heading: Brief summary of the service
service_in_brief.paragraph0: NVA is a service for collecting and displaying information about, and results from, Norwegian research. The institution (the data controller) registers and maintains its own content in the service, and configures rules for distribution of published resources (articles, reports, datasets, etc.). The service also imports material affiliated with the institution from other sources. NVA ensures access to the institution's open material via open interfaces for the purpose of making the content known and searchable for the public, and to promote indexing in search engines/portals.
service_in_brief.paragraph1: NVA has support for deferred publication of resources. This means that the registration can be completed so that metadata about the resource is published, while the resource will not be openly available until the specified date.
service_in_brief.paragraph2: The service does not allow the processing of sensitive personal data.

what_are_personal_data.heading: What is personal data?
what_are_personal_data.paragraph: Personal data means any data, information and assessments that can be linked to you as an individual, cf. the <0>Personal Data Act Section 2</0> and the <1>GDPR Article 5</1>(1). The deciding factor as to what constitutes personal data, is whether the information can be linked to a specific person. Data that can not be linked to an individual may still be personal data in cases where it occurs together with other information.

section0.heading: Right to information and access
section0.paragraph0: You have a right to receive information about how your personal data are processed in the service. This privacy statement has been produced to provide the information you have a right to receive. You also have a right to see/access your personal data that are registered in the service, and other personal data that are collected after you have actively logged in. You also have the right to request to receive a copy of your personal data.
section0.paragraph1: A self-service solution in the service where users can see their personal data after logging in allows users to exercise their right of access. If the service does not provide complete information via the self-service solution, users can send a written enquiry to the data controller’s user support to acquire access to more detailed information.

section1.heading: Right to correction
section1.paragraph0: You have a right to have inaccurate personal data about you rectified. You also have a right to have incomplete personal data about you supplemented. If you feel that the service shows inaccurate or incomplete personal data, please contact the data controller, stating the reason why the personal data are inaccurate or incomplete.
section1.paragraph1: Please note that there is a limited possibility to correct data that is distributed via open interfaces.

section2.heading: Right to restriction of processing

paragraph0.bullet_point0: Pending the data controller correcting inaccurate or incomplete personal data
paragraph0.bullet_point1: If you have submitted an objection to the processing (see below for more details)
paragraph0.bullet_point2: If the personal data are necessary to establish or defend a legal claim
paragraph0.intro: In certain cases, you may have a right to request restrictions on the processing of your personal data. Restricted processing means that the personal data will still be stored, but that other processing in the service is restricted. To request restricted processing of personal data, the conditions in the Personal Data Act and the <0>GDPR Article 18</0> must be met. You can request restricted processing:

section2.paragraph1: If restricted processing is granted, the data controller will notify you before the restriction is lifted.

section3.heading: Right to erasure
section3.paragraph0: You have the right to demand that we erase personal data about you. If you would like your personal data to be erased, please contact the data controller. It is important that your request states why you want your personal data erased and, if possible, what personal data you wish to be erased.
section3.paragraph1: Please note that legislation provides exemptions from the right to erasure in some cases. This could be cases where we process personal data to fulfil a statutory duty or to address important social interests, such as archiving, research and statistics. In cases where the users themselves have registered content in the service, we are not able to erase user information without also erasing the registered content.
section3.paragraph2: Please note that there is also a limited possibility of erasing personal data that are distributed via open interfaces.

section4.heading: Right to object

paragraph0.bullet_point0: Legal grounds for the processing of personal data are based on legitimate interests, reasons of public interest or when exercising public authority
paragraph0.bullet_point1: Processing of personal data entails direct marketing or profiling
paragraph0.bullet_point2: Personal data are processed for scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes
paragraph0.intro: You have a right to object to processing of your personal data on certain conditions defined in the <0>GDPR Article 21</0>. This applies if:

section4.paragraph1: The service does not generally satisfy these conditions, with the exception of the processing of author information and in cases where personal data are used for statistical purposes. When personal data are used for statistical purposes, the data are anonymised.

paragraph2.bullet_point0: If there is a special need to stop the processing, for example if you have a need for protection, or a confidential address or similar, please contact the data controller
paragraph2.bullet_point1: When you have consented to the processing of personal data, you have a right to withdraw your consent

section5.heading: Right to complain about the processing
section5.paragraph0: If you feel that we have not processed personal data in a correct or lawful manner, or if you feel that you have been unable to exercise your rights with us, you have a right to complain about the processing. See our contact details below.
section5.paragraph1: If we do not uphold your complaint, you have the possibility of filing a complaint with the Norwegian Data Protection Authority. The Data Protection Authority is responsible for ensuring that Norwegian enterprises comply with the provisions of the Personal Data Act and the GDPR in their processing of personal data.

project.close_view_description: Unsaved data you have entered will be lost if you close this view. Do you still want to close it?

contributors.must_select_type_first: You must select a resource type before you can add contributors.

registration.curator_support_info: Here you can ask your curator for help with everything related to the registration and publication of research results. You can find answers to your questions on "My page" and on the registration presentation page.

description.confirm_remove_vocabulary_text: Are you sure you want to remove vocabulary for {{vocabulary}}?
description.create_project_helper_text: <0>The researcher defines their own projects.</0> <0>A project must have a title, a project leader, a coordinating institution, a start and end date. A project can have project participants, funders, approvals or research results.</0> <0>If you have an RCN grant, you can establish a project with that as a starting point. You start by looking up your RCN funding, it is added to the project and all mandatory fields are pre-filled, except for the project leader who must be looked up and confirmed.</0> <0>(Similar functionality is planned based on an REC approval. All projects that are to be part of the KBS reporting must have a REC approval that identifies the project as a clinical treatment study.)</0>
description.description_of_content: Description of content. Particularly relevant when registering, for example, artistic development work

funding.funding_helper_text: <0>You can register funding directly on the result. This is particularly relevant if you do not know which project the result is part of, or if the result has other funders than the project it may belong to.</0> <0>If the result is linked to a project, it will inherit all project funding. It is not necessary to enter the same funding twice.</0>
funding.nfr_project_search: Search by project name or project leader

description.keywords_helper: Separate keywords with commas or enter
description.npi_disciplines: Scientific field in Norwegian publication indicator
description.project_helper_text: <0>If you register a funding source on a project, the results you link to that project will "inherit" information about funding. This means you don't have to register all funding sources on all the results of the project. If you search for the funding source in NVA, you will get hits on both the project and the results, and reporting to the Research Council or others will include all results.</0> <0>A result can be linked to several projects.</0>

files_and_license.administrative_contract: Internal file that should never be published. E.g. author agreement or other documentation for the registered result
files_and_license.file_and_license_info: Every file in NVA must have a license, so that the reader is informed about what they are allowed to do with the content.
files_and_license.file_publish_date_helper_text: File is locked until the specified date
files_and_license.files_awaits_approval_one: {{count}} file and selected licence are waiting to be verified
files_and_license.files_awaits_approval_other: {{count}} files and selected licences are waiting to be verified
files_and_license.find_journal_in_channel_register: See information about the journal in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.find_publisher_in_channel_register: See information about the publisher in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.find_series_in_channel_register: See information about the series in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.follow_institution_rights_policy: I wish to follow the <0>rights policy</0> of my institution.
files_and_license.info_from_channel_register: More information about the selected publication channel
files_and_license.institution_prefers_cc_by: Your institution has a <0>rights policy</0> that recommends CC-BY.
files_and_license.institution_rights_policy_opt_out_instru: If you wish to opt out of the institution's rights policy, you must check if this is possible at your institution. Contact curator support.
files_and_license.mark_if_funder_requires_rrs: If this publication is funded by an actor who requires you to follow RRS (ref. Plan S), then you indicate that here.
files_and_license.no_duplicates: Cannot add "{{fileName}}", because a file with the same name already exists
files_and_license.no_files_or_links_present_in_this_regist: No file or link has been added for the registration
files_and_license.opted_out_of_rrs: You have chosen not to follow the adopted <0>rights policy</0>
files_and_license.resource_has_no_files_or_links: The resource does not have any files or links to publish
files_and_license.resource_is_a_reference: The resource is a reference and has no files or links to publish
files_and_license.version_accepted_helper_text: <0>Accepted version</0>: The version of a research paper accepted by a journal after peer review. This version does not normally include any changes made after acceptance such as copy editing, or typesetting. This version should be shared in NVA, preferable in PDF format and under a CC-BY license.
files_and_license.version_accepted_helper_text_metadata_on: <0>Accepted version</0>: The version of a research paper accepted by a journal after peer review. This version does not normally include any changes made after acceptance such as copy editing, or typesetting. This version should be shared in NVA, preferable in PDF format and under a CC-BY license.
files_and_license.version_embargo_helper_text: <0>Embargo/delayed date of publication</0>: most publishers will not allow the author to make the published version of the article openly available until a certain time has passed. The date is usually specified in the publishing agreement. In some cases, even the accepted version may have similar restrictions.
files_and_license.version_helper_text: <0>Upload the accepted and/or published versions of the article. If the published version of the article is openly available, you don’t have to upload the accepted version.</0> <1>Include any publishing agreements, like formal contracts or other communication with the editor. The documents should specify conditions for embargo and licenses. <0>Remember to mark for “not publish”, to hide the documents from public view.</0></1>
files_and_license.version_helper_text_metadata_only: Upload the accepted and/or published version of the article and publishing agreements, such as formal contracts or other communication with the editor. A curator at your institution will review the files and ensure that only the files you are allowed to share are shared, and that they have been assigned the correct licenses.
files_and_license.version_published_helper_text: <0>Published version</0>: Also known as VOR or the “version of record”. The published version of the article in a journal, in print and/or online. This version will include any editorial improvements such as copy editing, or typesetting, made after the peer review process is complete. It is usually available on a publisher website, in PDF format. The license is normally decided by the publisher, so the safe option for a license is “Publisher's conditions”. Many publishers support Open Access and allow use of the CC-BY license.
files_and_license.version_published_helper_text_metadata_o: <0>Published version</0>: Also known as VOR or the “version of record”. The published version of the article in a journal, in print and/or online. This version will include any editorial improvements such as copy editing, or typesetting, made after the peer review process is complete. It is usually available on a publisher website, in PDF format. The license is normally decided by the publisher, so the safe option for a license is “Publisher's conditions”. Many publishers support Open Access and allow use of the CC-BY license.
files_and_license.version_publishing_agreement_helper_text: <0>The Author Agreement</0> is a contract between a publisher and an artist or author. It specifies matters such as intellectual ownership, where and how the work can be published, payments, liability protection, confidentiality and royalty. This document is of great help to curators when making assessments about license and publication date (embargo). Such documents will not be visible to others.

<0>Publishing Agreement</0> is a contract between a publisher and the artist or author. It sets out things like intellectual property ownership, where and when the work can be published, payment terms, liability protections, confidentiality, and royalties. This document is of much help for the curators when questions about license and publications dates needs to be decided on, please deposit it. Such agreements will not be publicly displayed.

registration.modal_unsaved_changes_description: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to leave this page?

nvi_warning.approval_override_warning: You have made significant changes to the publication. This means all institutions with participating co-authors must re-approve the publication in order for it to be included in this year's NVI report.
nvi_warning.confirm_saving_registration: Do you want to save your changes?
nvi_warning.continue_editing_registration: Do you still want to edit the publication?
nvi_warning.registration_is_included_in_nvi: The publication is a part of the Norwegian Science Index (NVI)
nvi_warning.reset_nvi_warning: You may change the year, contributor's affiliation(-s) to institution(-s) or publishing channel, but curators at all contributing institutions must re-approve the publication in the Norwegian Science Index (NVI)

public_page.error_description: To publish you must fix the following errors:
public_page.find_in_channel_registry: Find in the Norwegian register for publishers
public_page.preview_unavailable: Preview not available. Open file in suited program.
public_page.publishing_request_message_about: You can use the message field for dialogue with the registrar if needed.
public_page.request_doi_description: When you request a DOI (Digital Object Identifier), the order will go through a curator at your institution for quality control. Add a message in case of any questions or clarifications.

tasks_panel.approve_publishing_request_description: <0>As a curator, you can approve or reject files with licenses for this research result.</0><0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.approve_publish_request)" they will immediately be available to everyone.</0>
tasks_panel.assign_doi_about: In order for others to be able to use the DOI, you must assign it. Metadata must be published.
tasks_panel.files_will_soon_be_published: The Files will be published soon. Reload page to see updated status.
tasks_panel.has_rejected_files_publishing_request: Registration has a rejected publishing request for its files.
tasks_panel.has_reserved_doi: Registration has received a reserved DOI. When the registration is published a DOI request will be created and sent to curator.
tasks_panel.metadata_published_waiting_for_files: Metadata is published and visible to other users, but a curator must approve the uploaded files before they will be visible.
tasks_panel.registration_is_published: The registration has been published. Metadata and any files are publicly available.
tasks_panel.registration_is_published_with_files: The registration is published. Metadata and file(s) are publicly available.
tasks_panel.registration_is_published_workflow2: <0>The file and license are approved and public in NVA.</0><0>You are free to change the description of the result, but if you change the file or license, the registration must be approved again.</0>
tasks_panel.registration_will_soon_be_published: The registration will be published soon. Reload page to see updated status.
tasks_panel.reject_publishing_request_description_on: <0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.reject_publish_request)", the file will not be published and therefore will not be visible to others. The file will be moved to unpublished.</0><0>If you wish to delete the file, do so in the editing of the research result.</0>
tasks_panel.reject_publishing_request_description_ot: <0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.reject_publish_request)", the files will not be published and therefore will not be visible to others. The files will be moved to unpublished.</0><0>If you wish to delete the files, do so in the editing of the research result.</0>
tasks_panel.waiting_for_rejected_doi: It can take some time before the reserved DOI is removed. Reload to check again.
tasks_panel.you_can_publish_everything: You can publish on your own. The content will then be visible to other users.
tasks_panel.you_can_publish_metadata: You can publish metadata yourself, but a curator must approve the files you uploaded before they can be displayed to other users.
tasks_panel.you_can_publish_metadata_files_info: When file(s) and selected license have been approved by the curator, they will be made public.

registration.registration_doi_validation_message: This result is already published in NVA. If it has errors or omissions, the result must be corrected.
registration.start_with_link_to_resource_description: Link to original version if the resource already has been published on the Internet
registration.start_with_link_to_resource_title: Start with link to original version
registration.start_with_uploading_file_description: Upload file if the resource isn't published on the Internet

artistic.remove_announcement_description: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from list of announcements?
artistic.remove_music_work_description: Are you sure you want to remove this work?

resource_type.change_registration_type_description: Note that this can lead to some data getting lost in the case where existing data are not valid for the new type. Are you sure you want to change the registration type?

chapter.info_anthology: The anthology in which this chapter is published in must be published first
chapter.info_book_of_abstracts: The abstract collection in which this abstract is published in must be published first
chapter.info_report: The report in which the chapter is published in must be published first
chapter.search_for_anthology: Search for the anthology where the chapter is published
chapter.search_for_book_of_abstracts: Search for the book of abstracts where the abstract is published
chapter.search_for_report: Search for the report where the chapter is published

resource_type.click_to_change_resource_type: Click on selected resource type to change it

media_contribution.name_of_issue_episode: Name of issue, episode, etc. (if relevant)
media_contribution.name_of_series_program: Name of series, program, etc. (if relevant)

nvi.applicable: The publication can be included in the Norwegian Science Index
nvi.channel_not_rated: The publication can not be included in the Norwegian Science Index since the publication channel is not at level 1 or 2. (The level can be changed before the year's reporting deadline so that the publication can be included in the Norwegian Science Index)

resource_type.protected_degree_type: You do not have access. Contact the institution that awarded you the degree to have it published. If it is foreign, ask for curatorial support with the publication.
resource_type.protected_file_type: Your institution has chosen not to support file upload for this category
resource_type.remove_doi_text:
You can remove the DOI that was used when starting registration.
Do you want to remove the link to the original DOI?

accept_dataset_terms.contains_personal_data: Does the data set contain personal data?*
accept_dataset_terms.contains_personal_data_description: Personal data is any data about an individual that is identified or makes them identifiable. This can be a name, address, phone number, e-mail, picture, sound recording, fingerprint, online identifier, location data, etc.
accept_dataset_terms.contains_sensitive_data: Does the dataset contain other sensitive or confidential data?*
accept_dataset_terms.contains_sensitive_data_description: Sensitive or confidential data and information is data that requires protection and shielding. As such it must be secured against unauthorized access. This could be personal data, company secrets, security information, commercial rights, patents, etc.
accept_dataset_terms.dialog_title: To add research data you must first declare that
accept_dataset_terms.further_info: When you click YES or are unsure, you must send a message to support where your curator will clarify the further process to publish the dataset.

research_data.external_link_helper_text: Add external link with related content
research_data.external_link_helper_text_error: Invalid URL. Ensure that the link is complete. Example: https://sikt.no
research_data.no_publications_using_dataset: No publications are using the dataset.
research_data.remove_relation_confirm_text: Do you want to remove this relation?
research_data.search_for_related_dmps: Search for related data management plans
research_data.search_for_related_registrations_helper: Choose from registrations published in NVA

resource_type.series_info: If the publication is part of a series

curator_help.already_in_progress: You already have a dialogue with the curator. Save and go to the result via MY PAGE to continue the dialogue there.
curator_help.description: <0>Here you can send a message directly to the curator at your institution.</0><0>The curator can help you register and change published and unpublished research results.</0><0>You will receive a response on MY PAGE, where you can see who your curator(s) are. Curator support can be answered by different curators at your institution.</0>
curator_help.header: Do you need help from a curator?

self_help.description: Do you need help? See if you can solve the problem yourself by looking at the user guides.
self_help.header: Guide to register a research result

search.search_placeholder: Search for title, contributor, abstract, etc.
search.search_project_placeholder: Search for title, project ID, grant ID or participant

nvi.delete_note_description: Are you sure you want to delete this note?
nvi.reporting_period_closed: The reporting period for this result is closed.
nvi.reporting_period_missing: The reporting period for this result is not open.

tasks.search_placeholder: Search by title, contributor, summary or similar

unpublish_actions.search_duplicate_facets: Search with DOI, handle or title
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_detail_1: Upon unpublishing, the research result will not be searchable in NVA, but will still be available when looking up the reference.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_detail_2: Any files will be removed from the research result by unpublishing, but will not be permanently deleted.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_duplicate_citatio: In order for all citations to be carried forward, you must look up the other registration. Then all citations will still lead to the other version
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_duplicate_questio: Is there another published version of the same research result?
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_reason: Enter a brief justification for why this research result should no longer be published. The justification will be displayed on the research result when looking up the reference to the research result.
